item.title: Social Networks in Pre-Revolutionary Poland
item.description: Co-Authors: Gregory Domber and Kien Nguyen. Historical Context In 1989, the country of Poland underwent a peaceful revolution, replacing its existing Communist government with a Democratically elected one. The culminating moment of this process was a Round Table agreement reached between leaders of the Opposition and Communist groups. How did this movement build over the decades prior, and how did these two groups come together?
